creator: emasmith
title: Hearts A'Bursting
description: This project involves creating an animated heart, inspired by Valentine's Day, using a 3D printed heart, an Arduino, and a servo to make it move.
steps: Wire the servo to the Arduino. Connect the servo wires directly to the Arduino, referring to a servo wiring diagram for guidance.
Program the Arduino using the 'Sweep' example, modifying the code to control the servo's movement.  Specifically, adjust 'pos += #' to change the degree increments
Print the two-part heart from the provided Thingiverse link.
Glue the servo into the 3D printed heart.
Test the servo to ensure it is functioning correctly within the heart.
Glue the two parts of the heart together.
Decorate the heart as desired, potentially adding details like simulated blood droplets using glue.

creator: emasmith
title: Hearts A'Bursting
description: This project involves creating a 'Hearts A'Bursting' art piece using a 3D printed heart, an Arduino Uno, and a servo to make the heart appear dynamic. The project is inspired by Valentine's Day and involves wiring, programming, and assembling the components before decorating the final product.
steps: Wire the servo to the Arduino Uno, following a diagram and connecting the wires directly to the Arduino.
Program the Arduino to control the servo's movement, using the provided code snippet adapted from the Arduino Sweep tutorial to make the servo sweep back and forth in 90-degree increments.
Download and 3D print the two-part heart model from the provided Thingiverse link.
Glue the servo inside the 3D printed heart, ensuring it functions correctly before securing it.
Glue the two parts of the heart together.
Decorate the assembled heart to your preference, such as adding paint to simulate blood dripping.
